alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:06PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yuma and northwestern Kit Carson Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 605 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cope, or 25 miles north of Seibert, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Yuma and northwestern Kit Carson Counties, including the following locations... Kirk and Joes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.
